<a id="InputEventAction"></a>

# InputEventAction

**Inherits:** [InputEvent](InputEvent.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

An input event type for actions.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Contains a generic action which can be targeted from several types of inputs. Actions and their events can be set in the **Input Map** tab in **Project &gt; Project Settings**, or with the [InputMap](InputMap.md) class.

\ **Note:** Unlike the other [InputEvent](InputEvent.md) subclasses which map to unique physical events, this virtual one is not emitted by the engine. This class is useful to emit actions manually with [Input.parse_input_event()](Input.md#Input_method_parse_input_event), which are then received in [Node._input()](Node.md#Node_private_method__input). To check if a physical event matches an action from the Input Map, use [InputEvent.is_action()](InputEvent.md#InputEvent_method_is_action) and [InputEvent.is_action_pressed()](InputEvent.md#InputEvent_method_is_action_pressed).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="InputEventAction_property_action"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[StringName](StringName.md) **action** = `&""` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventAction_property_action)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_action**\ (\ value\: [StringName](StringName.md)\ )
- [StringName](StringName.md) **get_action**\ (\ )

The action's name. This is usually the name of an existing action in the [InputMap](InputMap.md) which you want this custom event to match.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEventAction_property_event_index"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **event_index** = `-1` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventAction_property_event_index)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_event_index**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_event_index**\ (\ )

The real event index in action this event corresponds to (from events defined for this action in the [InputMap](InputMap.md)). If ``-1``, a unique ID will be used and actions pressed with this ID will need to be released with another **InputEventAction**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEventAction_property_pressed"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **pressed** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventAction_property_pressed)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_pressed**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_pressed**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the action's state is pressed. If ``false``, the action's state is released.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEventAction_property_strength"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **strength** = `1.0` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventAction_property_strength)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_strength**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_strength**\ (\ )

The action's strength between 0 and 1. This value is considered as equal to 0 if pressed is ``false``. The event strength allows faking analog joypad motion events, by specifying how strongly the joypad axis is bent or pressed.
